snippet: As officials sought a motive for Paul A. Ciancia, charged in the death of a T.S.A. agent, it became clear that he was a drifter with a grudge against the government.
abstract: Prosecutors bring two federal charges against Paul A Ciancia for his shooting spree in Los Angeles International Airport, which left security agent Gerardo I Hernandez dead; as law enforcement officials seek a motive, it has become clear that Ciancia was a drifter who had come to Los Angeles without an apparent job and with little money.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and IAN LOVETT
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Noah Gilbert from Los Angeles; Alan Feuer from New York; Michael S. Schmidt and Matthew L. Wald from Washington; Bryon MacWilliams from Wilmington, Del.; and Jon Hurdle from Pennsville, N.J.

lead_paragraph: As officials sought a motive for Paul A. Ciancia, charged in the death of a T.S.A. agent, it became clear that he was a drifter with a grudge against the government.

headline.main: At Los Angeles International Airport, Two Lives Collide in a Fatal Instant
headline.print_headline: 2 Lives Collide In Fatal Instant At Busy Airport
